reviews.text: A fantastic place to stay that is clean, tidy, friendly and affordable. The free internet access was great as was the breakfast. The hotel is just a five minute walk from the town center and I would highly recommend it to anyone visiting the area. Thank-you for a great stay.
reviews.title: Fantastic customer service

reviews.text: My teenage son and I stayed here for one night when we came to see a show at Stratford. I agree with some of the other reviews that the outside of this hotel is not very attractive--it's basically a bland, brown building--but the inside is fine. The lobby is fairly small but has a nice fireplace and some chairs for resting in. The desk staff was pleasant and our check-in was fast and smooth. Our room was larger than many double rooms I have stayed in, which was nice--it felt like we had a bit more room to spread out. The room was very clean; the decor felt slightly dated (kind of beige-ish, although there were a few paintings that brightened it up a bit) but it was fine. The bathroom was a nice size and the tub was huge! (In fact, that would be my one caution--if you have trouble stepping up into a deep tub, you might ask when you make your reservation if all of the rooms have these. I could see it being a problem for some people.)
reviews.title: Nice hotel; fine for our needs

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The beds were comfortable although the pillows were a bit overly firm for our taste. The room was quiet and we liked having the temperature control via a thermostat on the wall as opposed to one of those noisy window units you often get in hotels.
reviews.title: Better than Expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed January 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We didn't try the restaurant, but there is a William's coffee place just next door which serves breakfast items and is very nice.
reviews.title: Unfriendly staff dragged review down

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2009, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: In terms of proximity to Stratford and the theaters, it is just a short walk from the Festival Theatre (maybe 10 minutes) although be advised that coming back from the theater you will be walking a bit uphill. There is ample parking at the theater so you can certainly drive there if you'd rather. The hotel is a fair distance from the main downtown shopping part of Stratford and the other theaters--I'd say a good 20 minute walk. Unless you enjoy walking and aren't planning to buy many heavy items, I'd say you'd have to drive from the hotel to the shopping area.
reviews.title: A pleasant surprise in Stratford

reviews.text: We just got back from a 3 day conference at the Arden Park. We really enjoyed our stay! The pool and whirlpool area was lovely. The staff was friendly and courteous. Our room was clean, beautifully updated, and the beds comfortable. The hotel is not much to look at on the outside, but inside it is quite lovely! The conference room was bright, lots of windows, and had comfortable chairs and tables. The washrooms were clean and well decorated. The only negative...the food served during the conference was basic and bland. The same desert was served three days in a row.....chocolate brownies and squares from frozen boxes. No fruit to speak of. Overall though, I would stay there again, just not eat there.
reviews.title: Elegant, clean rooms!

reviews.text: Very well run hotel, nice staff, good service. Despite the stark exterior, the hotel inisde is pleasant and comfortable. Our southeast suite was very comfortable. General manager Mr. Hayter personally replies to your emails and he arranged an early chek-in for us, which made a difference, so we could settle in our room before going for a matinee show.
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Stratford
Clean & Beautiful... BUT!
reviews.text: The rooms are clean and beautiful - we had a King Size "suite" which was very large, HOWEVER we were on the second floor - rooms 217 & 219, directly above their conference centre which was holding a wedding party and an engagement party. We were kept up with the sound of banging bass until 1:30am!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I stay here every year and was surprised to see negative reviews of the staff. I have never had a problem with anyone at the front desk; in fact early Sunday morning when we were leaving the front desk clerk took time to offer us coffee and the paper. We were quite content will all the help we received(although we don't use much at the hotel except the room).
reviews.title: Best in Stratford

reviews.text: This continues to be the best option in Stratford in my opinion. Walk to Festival Theatre, even downtown if you are a walker. Quick drive to grocery and other stores. Big, clean rooms and our room on the 4th floor was very quiet.
reviews.title: OK Hotel but Snippy Manager

reviews.text: "Railroadruth" has written a negative comment here and i would just like to clarify what really happened as i was a guest on that particular night as well. I happened to have been at the Arden Park that day in June and ijust so happened to have been in the pool area that night. "chris" or the night manager that was working, had come into the pool area at 10pm to advise pool goers that the pool closes at 10pm and that he would keep it open for another 15 min. i waited for his return before i got out. When he did return, everyone was still in the pool and he gave a 10min warning, and of course 10 min later when he returned and everyone was still in the pool he did not get "snippy" he merely said in 5min he would lock the doors as it was now 10:30pm and the sign on the door clearly stated 10pm. this guest pulled the manager aside and chastized him in front of the rest of the hotel guests about him being told it was open until 11 even though it stated on the door 10pm as u enter the pool area. To use the staff members name in this forum has got to be against some privacy law to start with but in any event this event did not fold out the way this ignorant customer makes it sound. This customer was looking for a "free ride" and used every excuse to get it.
reviews.title: speaking for the other guy

reviews.text: Stratford is a lovely little university and artsy town in Ontario. A conference was held at the hotel and the staff were outstanding. The hotel was clean and tastefully decorated. It has 144 rooms, restaurant, bar, swimming pool and free internet access. it is a short walk to downtown Stratford, the Canadian show place for drama.
reviews.title: Good Accomodations

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If you enjoy staying in a hotel which looks like a hospital from the outside and has the depressing atmosphere and look of a home for the aged inside, then this is the place for you! Caught at the last minute and wanting to see some theatre over a couple of days, this was one of the few hotels or Inns that were not sold out. Now we know why. The room was dark and dreary in spite of blazing sunshine outside due to the inordinately small window and the black-out drapes bleed through the light at dawn. The bathroom was very clean and the beds were comfortable. Those were the only positives I can think of. The dining room hostess informed us that the kitchen could not keep up with dinner orders (this on a thursday night) when we wanted to dine and so we went and had a wonderful meal at Pazzo much further down the street. They definitely could keep up. The front desk staff were a prize-winning study in indifference both at check-in and check-out. All this would be fine if the rate we had paid reflected this, however the rate paid was nearly twice as much as what one would expect to pay for what was received. Avoid if possible. Much better accommodations elsewhere (Swan Motel,Mercer Hall Inn,Foster's,Bentley's...etc).
reviews.title: Overpriced and underwhelming

reviews.text: After almost 20 years of attending the shakespeare festival, we have tried almost all of the hotels/motels in the stratford area. When the arden park first opened, we were delighted. We have been booking reservations there for our family's annual stratford trip every year since then. However, this will be our last year. We usually book a suite so all of us can fit in the room, and in the past it has been a truly wonderful experience.
reviews.title: Avoid this place!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This was not the case this year. The rooms were not clean. Dirt and dust was along the edges of the carpet, which was horribly stained. The tub was cracked. The housekeeping service didn't even bother to leave new towels and extra toilet paper (basic things when a family of 4 stays, right?). On top of that, we usually stop in the restaurant downstairs after an evening play for a lovely cup of cocoa and a dessert to discuss the play we just saw. However, at 9:30pm we were greeted with the apology that the "kitchen closed at 9pm". We ended up with watered down from a MIX hot chocolate and a sour taste metaphorically and literally left in our mouths as we walked out. Customer service is now non-existent at a once lovely hotel. I do not know what has changed, but we were not the only family to take note of this. We can honestly say that we were completely and utterly dismayed and disappointed with our stay. We will never return to the Arden Park Hotel and I am writing this review to warn others of such an overpriced, under-whelming place. I hope I have helped someone else avoid this place by writing this review. I wish someone had done the same for me and my family!
reviews.title: Great place to stay in Stratford

reviews.text: This must be our 8th trip to Stratford as a family - we are blessed with children who enjoy theatre. We have been revisiting the Arden Park each year and staying in connecting or adjoining rooms.
reviews.title: Always Stay at the Arden Park

reviews.text: The hotel is in some ways average, but I upgrade it for having free wi-fi. On top of that, we've always (except once) had clean and comfortable rooms. We know what to expect when we check-in and the Arden Park delivers.
reviews.title: Decent and comfy hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We find the hotel quite convenient and often walk the 20 minutes to downtown. While one could easily walk to the Festival Theatre, it is apparently somewhat painful in heels! So we do generally drive there.
reviews.title: A decent choice in Stratford

reviews.text: Overall, would recommend the Arden Park, particularly for families. It is a great choice for the theatre goer.
reviews.title: I would not stay there again as there are plenty of other hotels in Stratford.

reviews.text: We stayed one night at this hotel because we were in town for a wedding. I booked three king rooms (for ourselves and the in-laws) and at the time of booking requested that two of the rooms be adjoining. Upon check in, the person helping us was a bit on the surly side but we got the adjoining rooms that we had asked for so I was happy.
reviews.title: Awesome place
